text: Hi its Ravena :joy: im not really sure what im intrested in to be honest, but my top three are accounting or medicine or customer service in Ba
My main priority right now would be get to know what accounting is, how it works, and get a work  experience in it so that i can see myself if accounting would suit me or not

No problem. Cool let's start by exploring Accounting then!

*Essentially every business needs an Accountant* to ensure their finances are in order (and accurate, which is a legal obligation), as well as optimized e.g. to ensure they aren't paying too much or too little tax, and to report numbers to Senior Management to help them make the best decisions in running the business.

Larger companies (such as Tesco, BP, etc.) will have their own in-house Accountancy teams to do this work (but still might use external Accountancy companies to do other financey tasks), whereas slightly smaller companies might "outsource" this to an Accountancy company to just do the work a couple of times a year.

These Accountancy companies can vary in size from "The Big Four" (i.e. the largest Accountancy companies in the World are called EY, Deloitte, KPMG, and PriceWaterhouseCoopers/PwC) to a small accountancy company on the high street that will work with small businesses.

So as an Accountant you probably want to aspire to work in The Big Four or in-house at a large corporate (such as Tesco, BP etc), as that is where the money/training/good reputation is! Indeed lots of these companies will do apprenticeships/work experience/insight days, but to start with you would still learn something from the local Accountancy companies on your local high street for example

Just so that I can advise you as best as I can, what sort of grades are you likely to achieve in your A-Levels? (Note: I don't think grades should matter that much, but of course some companies/universities do so its good to consider what options we realistically have for you!)
By the way here is a good overview of the "Chartered Accountant" job role >> <https://www.prospects.ac.uk/job-profiles/chartered-accountant>

attachments.text: Discover what it takes to be a Chartered accountant. Find out expected salary, working hours, qualifications and more.

text: It's good to give those a quick read to see if it exites you!

When I worked in Finance/Accounting I got to see how lots of different types of businesses were run and how to potentially improve/make them more efficient...just be looking at their accounts! That's what I loved about it. It also helped me learn skills that I used in jobs later in my career (and still use today!)
